item.title: DUET students among 10 injured in Gazipur fair clash
item.description: At least 10 people, including students from Dhaka University of Engineering and Technology (DUET), were injured in a clash at a fair in Gazipur on Saturday night. The incident occurred around 11:00 pm at the Army Pharma grounds of trade and cottage industry fair in Shimultoli area during a concert

item.title: BB halts savings certificate, other citizen services
item.description: Bangladesh Bank has suspended all citizen-facing services, including the buying, selling and encashment of national savings certificates, at all of its offices. The halt also covers prize bond services, the exchange of torn or damaged banknotes, and A-challan transactions, officials said. The sus

item.title: Three injured as ‘Tawhidi Janata’ attack followers of Baul artiste
item.description: Three supporters of Baul artiste Abul Sarkar have reportedly been injured in an attack by members of the “Tawhidi Janata” -- a loosely defined movement that portrays itself as a defender of Islamic morality. Abdullah Al Mamun, the additional superintendent of Manikganj police, said tha

item.title: Stocks see downward trend at opening
item.description: Trading at both the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) and the Chittagong Stock Exchange (CSE) opened on a downward trend on Sunday, with most listed companies seeing a decline in share prices during the first hour. On the DSE, the benchmark DSEX index slipped by 7 points, while the Shariah-based DSES she

item.title: Commonwealth chief meets CEC
item.description: Commonwealth Secretary General Shirley Botchwey has held talks with Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin as preparations intensify for Bangladesh's upcoming parliamentary elections and referendum. The meeting took place at the Election Commission (EC) headquarters in Dhaka’s Agargaon

item.title: Clash at Titumir College over hanging of Shibir banner
item.description: Several people have reportedly been injured in a clash between two sides over the hanging of an Islami Chhatra Shibir banner at Dhaka’s Government Titumir College. The clash broke out around midnight on Saturday, but the situation has now returned to normal, Rasel Sarwar, chief of Banani Pol

item.title: Grameen Bank office set on fire in Kushtia
item.description: Miscreants set fire to a Grameen Bank office by pouring petrol on PTI Road in Kushtia district headquarters on Saturday night. The fire damaged parts of the signboard and the balcony grill but documents and materials inside the office remained unaffected. The office is located near the residence

item.title: Financial Instruments in the Banking Sector: Challenges and Way Forward
item.description: The accounting standards are sets of principles and guidelines required to follow in the recording of financial transactions and in the preparation and presentation of financial statements of any organisation. International Accounting Standards (IAS)/Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) are adopted

item.title: 5.3 magnitude earthquake jolts Myanmar coast
item.description: A 5.3-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Myanmar at 10:39 am (Bangladesh time) on Sunday at a depth of 10km. The tremor also affected neighbouring Thailand. According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the epicentre was located in the Andaman Sea, about 267 kilometres west-so

item.title: Bangladesh seal 217-run win over Ireland to complete series whitewash
item.description: Bangladesh clinched a dominant 217-run victory over Ireland in the second Test in Mirpur, sealing a 2-0 series whitewash. Chasing an improbable target of 509, Ireland were bowled out for 291 on Sunday despite a dogged 259-ball 71 from Curtis Campher, who held firm even as wickets tumbled around hi
